title: Some Cut-Approved Combat Boots Are on Sale
text:
1 item in this article Photo: Pari Dukovic; MICHAEL Michael Korsboots, at michaelkors.com; Dolce & Gabbana dress, at 717 Fifth Avenue; Styled by Devine Blacksher; /PARI DUKOVIC

You may have noticed some posts from our friends at the Strategist on the Cut. They’ll be dropping in every now and again, sharing their expertise on the basics you don’t have time to research and the weird and wonderful things you don’t yet know you need.

If you haven’t heard, ’90s-style combat books are back (and if you are curious as to why, read here). And these particular Michael by Michael Kors combat boots, which we wrote about a few weeks ago, and which were hand-plucked by our colleagues in the Cut’s fashion department as being wonderful, are currently 25 percent off as part of a wider 25 percent off Michael Kors sale.

We like that the toe is a little pointy (so it’s slightly more elegant than your classic combat boot), that they’re patent leather (so they’re kind of fancy), and that the heel is almost wedgelike (so they’re likely quite comfortable).

There’s also a cheetah-print calf-hair version on sale. As well as a more traditional combat boot with a higher, chunkier heel.

Michael by Michael Kors Haskell Combat Boots $149 (was $199, now 25% off) $149 at Macy's Buy

description: Today’s deal of the day is a pair of ‘90s-style combat boots from Michael Kors, which were hand-plucked by the Cut fashion department for being wonderful.
